newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London higher, HSBC features.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London higher, HSBC features.

text.p: Hong Kong shares in London gained on Friday with heavyweight stock HSBC Holdings leading the way, dealers said.
The Hang Seng London Reference index closed up 181.96 points at 13,263.66 after the Hang Seng index rallied in Hong Kong to finish 60.92 points higher at 13,081.70.

HSBC Holdings surged HK$4.12-1/2 in London to HK$201.62 -1/2, its first time over HK$ 200, as it was dragged higher by a stong performance by its London registered stock. HSBC's London registered shares climbed 40p to 16.81 stg by 1433 GMT.

Dealers said the overall tone in the market was firm encouraged by lower-than-expected non-farm payrolls data from the U.S. but lacked any real follow through in London as significant natural buyers failed to emerge.
